Description: Body fragment of pottery amphora; probably from shoulder; metallic black glaze on lower part, with remains of red band at break; thick horizontal red stripe and reserved zone above. Hard, orange clay, Munsell 2.5YR 6/6 (light reddish brown); dark mica.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Tell Dafana, "Qasr", east annex (C), chamber 19 A, bench on west side
Curator's comments: Findspot number '19A W' scratched on the reverse by Petrie.
Bibliographic references: Weber 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus anderen ägyptischen Fundorten (TD 350)
Acquisition notes: Found unregistered in the Department in 2010, in a box with other sherds from Tell Dafana.
